desc: Text processing and pattern-matching utility that is often used for data extraction and reporting.
Concatenate files and print on the standard output.
Automate the use of the Let's Encrypt protocol to get an SSL/TLS certificate for your website.
Transferring data with URLs, supporting various protocols like HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, and more.
Extract specific sections (bytes, characters, or fields) from lines within text files or standard input.
Print or set the system date and time.
Convert and cop files, primarily used for low-level tasks like creating disk images.
Display a report on the disk space usage of the file system.
Compare two files line by line, showing the differences between them.
Query DNS name servers to get information about DNS records.
Estimate and display the disk usage of files and directories.
Determine the type of a file.
Search for files and directories in a directory hierarchy based on criteria like name, type, or modification time.
Client for the firewalld daemon, used to manage firewall rules.
Shows the amount of free and used memory in the system.
An interactive filter program for any kind of list; files, command history, processes, hostnames, bookmarks, git commits, etc.
Search for lines containing a match to a specified pattern in one or more files.
Compression utility used to compress or decompress single files.
Output the first part of files, by default showing the first 10 lines.
Display the system's network name.
Monitor system input/output (I/O) statistics for devices, partitions, and network file systems (NFS).
Show and manipulate routing, devices, policy routing, and tunnels.
Lists all active, stopped, and running background jobs in the current shell, displaying their status, job number, and command.
Query and display logs from the systemd journal.
Command-line JSON processor widely used for slicing, filtering, mapping, and transforming structured JSON data.
Sends a signal to a process, usually to terminate it.
Lists the files and directories in the current directory.
Attaches a file system to a directory, making it accessible.
Networking utility for reading from and writing to network connections using TCP or UDP.
Show network connections, routing tables, and a number of network interface statistics.
Query Internet domain name servers to find out domain name or IP address mapping or other DNS records.
Run, create, and manage large language models locally.
Toolkit for managing cryptographic keys, certificates, and performing various SSL/TLS operations.
Change password.
Tests the network connectivity between your server and another device by sending ICMP ECHO_REQUEST packets and measuring the response time.
Displays information about active processes running on a system.
Synchronize files and directories from one location to another, either locally or remotely.
Stream editor for filtering and transforming text, line by line.
Reads the contents of a specified file (or standard input), sorts the data based on various criteria, and then prints the sorted output to standard output.
Network monitoring, troubleshooting, and security analysis by showing information about open sockets, including TCP, UDP, and listening ports.
Client program used to establish a secure, encrypted connection to a remote machine.
Enables non-root users who are part of the sudo group to execute administrative commands.
Control the systemd system and service manager, used to manage services, units, and the system state.
Output the last part of files, by default showing the last 10 lines, and can also follow a file as it grows.
Create, extract, and manipulate archive files, often referred to as "tarballs."
Outputs another command’s results to both the terminal and a file.
Display a real-time, dynamic view of system resource usage and running processes.
Traces the path packets take from your server to a specified destination, showing each hop along the way.
Displays system information, such as the kernel name, version, and machine hardware name.
Create a new account in your Linux system.
Remove account from Linux system.
Provides detailed information about processes, memory, paging, block I/O, traps, and CPU activity.
Execute a program periodically, showing output fullscreen.
Non-interactive network downloader that retrieves files from the web using HTTP, HTTPS, and FTP protocols.
Build and execute command lines from standard input.
